CLOCK_MODE().details: Machine-readable description of the clock as specified in ERC-6372.

DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().details: Returns the domain separator used in the encoding of the signature for {permit}, as defined by {EIP712}.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

batchClaimMerkleRewards(uint256[],uint25.details: All arrays must be the same length. Claims are processed in order.

params._capacities: Array of worker capacities associated with each claim
params._distributionIds: Array of distribution IDs to claim from
params._merkleProofs: Array of merkle proofs validating each claim

params._distributionIds: Array of distribution IDs to clean up

claimMerkleRewards(uint256,uint256,bytes.details: Users can claim their rewards by providing a valid Merkle proof

params._capacity: Worker capacity associated with rewards claim
params._distributionId: The ID of the distribution to claim from

cleanupExpiredDistribution(uint256).details: Can only clean distributions that are expired + additional cleanup delayPrevents cleanup if there are still unclaimed rewards

params._distributionId: The distribution ID to clean up

clock().details: Clock used for flagging checkpoints. Can be overridden to implement timestamp based checkpoints (and voting), in which case {CLOCK_MODE} should be overridden as well to match.

createMerkleDistribution(bytes32,uint256.details: Workers receive 85% of the total reward, validators receive 10%, dao receives 5%Rewards are distributed proportionally to workers based on their capacities.This function is called periodically by SmartnodesCore during state updates to distribute rewards.

params._dustValidator: Address of validator to receive dust rewards (usually the proposal executor)
params._merkleRoot: Root of state update and payments data
params._payments: Additional payments to be added to the current emission rate

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

delegate(address).details: Delegates votes from the sender to `delegatee`.

delegates(address).details: Returns the delegate that `account` has chosen.

eip712Domain().details: returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature.

params._payment: The amount of ETH payment to be escrowed
params._user: The address of the user making the payment

params._payment: The amount of payment to be escrowed
params._user: The address of the user receiving the payment

returns._0: Current emission rate for this era

getEscrowedPayments(address).details: Get escrowed payments for a specific address

getPastTotalSupply(uint256).details: Returns the total supply of votes available at a specific moment in the past. If the `clock()` is configured to use block numbers, this will return the value at the end of the corresponding block. NOTE: This value is the sum of all available votes, which is not necessarily the sum of all delegated votes. Votes that have not been delegated are still part of total supply, even though they would not participate in a vote. Requirements: - `timepoint` must be in the past. If operating using block numbers, the block must be already mined.

getPastVotes(address,uint256).details: Returns the amount of votes that `account` had at a specific moment in the past. If the `clock()` is configured to use block numbers, this will return the value at the end of the corresponding block. Requirements: - `timepoint` must be in the past. If operating using block numbers, the block must be already mined.

getSmartnodesCore().details: Get the current SmartnodesCore contract address

getVotes(address).details: Returns the current amount of votes that `account` has.

isLocked(address).details: Check if user has locked tokens

params._user: The address of the validator locking tokens

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

nonces(address).details: Override required by Solidity for multiple inheritance

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Sets `value` as the allowance of `spender` over ``owner``'s tokens, given ``owner``'s signed approval. IMPORTANT: The same issues {IERC20-approve} has related to transaction ordering also apply here. Emits an {Approval} event. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `deadline` must be a timestamp in the future. - `v`, `r` and `s` must be a valid `secp256k1` signature from `owner` over the EIP712-formatted function arguments. - the signature must use ``owner``'s current nonce (see {nonces}). For more information on the signature format, see the https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612#specification[relevant EIP section]. CAUTION: See Security Considerations above.

releaseEscrowedEthPayment(address,uint25.details: This releases the escrowed ETH to be available for distribution as rewardsThe ETH stays in the contract but is no longer considered escrowed

params._amount: The amount of escrowed ETH payment to be released
params._user: The address of the user whose escrowed ETH payment is being released

releaseEscrowedPayment(address,uint256).details: Can only be called by SmartnodesCore

params._amount: The amount of payment to be released
params._user: The address of the user who made the payment

setDAO(address).details: Sets the DAO contract address. Can only be called once by deployer before DAO is set.

params._dao: Address of the deployed DAO contract

setSmartnodes(address,address).details: Sets the Smartnodes contract addresses. Can only be called by DAO.

params._smartnodesCoordinator: Address of the deployed SmartnodesCoordinator contract
params._smartnodesCore: Address of the deployed SmartnodesCore contract

setUserLockAmount(uint256).details: Sets user lock amount. Can only be called by DAO.

setValidatorLockAmount(uint256).details: Sets validator lock amount. Can only be called by DAO.

slashAndUnlockValidator(address,uint256).details: Can only be called by DAO. Slashed tokens are burned and remaining tokens are returned to validator.This function combines slashing with timed unlock to prevent further misbehavior.

params._slashAmount: The amount of tokens to slash (burn)
params._validator: The address of the validator to slash

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Skips emitting an {Approval} event indicating an allowance update. This is not required by the ERC. See {xref-ERC20-_approve-address-address-uint256-bool-}[_approve]. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

unlockTokens(address).details: Can be called once to initiate the unlock process, and once again for claiming tokens after the unlock period

params._user: The address of the user unlocking tokens

batchClaimMerkleRewards(uint256[],uint25.notice: Batch claim rewards from multiple Merkle distributions

batchCleanupExpiredDistributions(uint256.notice: Batch cleanup of multiple expired distributions

claimMerkleRewards(uint256,uint256,bytes.notice: Claim rewards from a single Merkle distribution

cleanupExpiredDistribution(uint256).notice: Clean up expired distribution to save storage

createMerkleDistribution(bytes32,uint256.notice: Distribute rewards to workers and validators

doubleDistributionInterval().notice: Convenience function to double the distribution interval

escrowEthPayment(address,uint256).notice: Escrow ETH payment for a job

halveDistributionInterval().notice: Convenience function to halve the distribution interval

lockTokens(address,bool).notice: Lock tokens for a validator or user

releaseEscrowedEthPayment(address,uint25.notice: Release escrowed ETH payment for reward distribution

releaseEscrowedPayment(address,uint256).notice: Release escrowed payment to distribute as rewards

slashAndUnlockValidator(address,uint256).notice: Slash a validator's locked tokens and immediately unlock them

unlockTokens(address).notice: Unlock tokens for a user after the unlock period
